browser-action.name: waitselector
browser-action.description:
Wait for a selector.
Possible parameters are: - selector (required): The selector is a string that point to the elements in the page. Several types of selector are supported: text, CSS, XPath... You can wait for several elements at the same time by adding multiple "selector" parameters to this action. - timeout (optional): Forces the timeout for that action in ms. By default the OpenBrowser defaultTimeout is used. Maximum value is 200000. - state (optional): attached, detached, visible, hidden. Defaults to 'visible'. - frameIndex (optional): Frame index. - frameName (optional): Frame name. - frameSelector (optional): Frame selector. - ignoreErrors (optional): Set this option to true to ignore errors for this action. This is useful for handling conditional actions without having to resort to a "If...Then...Else" or a "Try...Catch" block. Default value is "false".
